Blends (scarlet.blend)¶

scarlet.blend contains the scarlet.blend.Blend class, the blended scene interpreted by the deblender.

Reference/API¶

class scarlet.blend.Blend(sources, img, weights=None, sky=None, bg_rms=None, refine_skip=10, center_min_dist=0.001, source_sizes=[15, 25, 45, 75, 115, 165], edge_flux_thresh=1.0, exact_lipschitz=False)[source]¶

The blended scene as interpreted by the deblender.

adjust_absolute_error()[source]¶

Adjust the absolute error for each source

component_of(m, l)[source]¶

Search for k index of source m, component l.

This is the inverse of source_of, and returns k for the given pair (m,l).

fit(steps=200, e_rel=0.01)[source]¶

Fit the model for each source to the data

steps: int
Maximum number of iterations if the algorithm doesn’t converge.
e_rel: float, default=`None`
Relative error for convergence. If e_rel is None, the default ~scarlet.blend.Blend.e_rel is used for convergence checks
self: ~scarlet.blend.Blend
This object, which contains the results of the deblender. For investigating the model components, use the source list specified at construction time or ~scarlet.blend.Blend.sources, which is the internal reference to that list.
get_model(m=None, combine=True, combine_source_components=True, use_sed=True, flat=True)[source]¶

Compute the current model for the entire image.

recenter_sources()[source]¶

Shift center position of sources to minimize residuals in all bands

resize_sources()[source]¶

Resize frames for sources (if necessary).

If for any source, the mean flux at the edges of the frame exceeds ~scarlet.edge_flux_thresh times the sky background in any band, increase the frame size of that source.

The increase is set at max(10, 0.25*size) for the size of the source frame in either direction.

set_data(img, weights=None, sky=None, bg_rms=None)[source]¶

Initialize the data.

Subtract the sky from the image, initialize the weights and background rms.

source_of(k)[source]¶

Get the indices of model component k.

Each of m ~scarlet.source.Source`s in the model can have multiple components, but the main algorithm recognizes each component as a single source, for `k=Sum_m(m_l) total sources. This method returns the tuple of indices (m,l) for source k.
